summary: Reflections on the learning experience of helping a student with code and realizing the value of practice
title: How Far We've Come

summary:
Inspired by Lou's recent post, Food Memories Are The Best, we got talking about our favourite memories of food and how we both love reading other people's trips down memory lane. 
Unlike Lou, I never really knew either of my grandmothers so I couldn't tell you if they even knew how to cook.  I met my dad's mum when I was little but, by then, she was in her late 60s and seem to live off Tunnock's Tea Cakes and tea she brewed on a paraffin stove she kept next to her chair...
title: For Love & Food

summary:
Interesting paper about a German cryptanalysis machine that helped break the US M-209 mechanical ciphering machine. 
The paper contains a good description of how the M-209 works.
title: Breaking the M-209

summary:
Back in the 90s when most folks of a certain age were discovering online
communities through USENET, BBSs, AOL and the like, no one really new
how to act.  Each community had a certain culture and through
trial-and-error people came to an agreement on what was good manners and
what was not.  Someone decided that typing in all caps was not a good
thing‚Ñ¢ and ever since then you pretty much get told off if you do
it too many times...
title: Remember When They Called It Netiquette?

summary:
Life is hard. 
From getting out of bed in the morning to bothering to take a shower and beyond.  The simplest of things feel unachievable these days...
